entry.title: Then He Kiss'd Me
entry.summary:
Author: Alwhisker

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,634Chapters: 8/20Kudos: 136

Summary: .... - "I didn‚Äôt need a glorified spandex ad to come to my aid" Wayne's tone was glowering and slightly breathless as he wiped the blood off his chin, looking over to the caped man who‚Äôd been covered in dust and rain, clark was taken aback, but remained his composure, it wasn't time to bicker with billionaires just yet.¬†"you're welcome" he muttered, floating up to look over the crowd, he watched as the officers surrounded Bruce Wayne, EMT's checking over his wounds as the criminals were carted away into padded cars, flashing lights of cameras clicking around the scene. but clark could only focus on the man wiping his bleeding lip, effortlessly drawing him in, among the thousands of voices in his mind, only one stood out.only one."Alfred, I promise you I am fine, I- no, my leg‚Äôs fine, Grayson. Damian, stop."Clark found himself grinning, soft enough that he didn't notice it at first, but the clicks of cameras and flashing lights woke him up from his daydream, the wind under his chin was getting colder, Gotham's air was gentle on his skin, despite the smog in the air and the scent of blood that somehow always lingered, no matter how much they scrubbed down the streets.

entry.summary:
Author: battinscnz

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,145Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 88

Summary: Bruce Wayne is no stranger to the spotlight‚Äîor the shadows it casts. Reclusive, haunted by tragedy, and heir to a name that carries more weight than comfort, he now faces something far more personal than public scrutiny: a stalker. The letters arrive like clockwork‚Äîtaunting, obsessive, familiar. And with Halloween approaching‚Äîthe anniversary of his parents' death‚Äîthe tension coils tighter.Clark Kent is a disciplined, quietly intense MMA-trained security specialist, brought in under General Sam Lane‚Äôs orders to keep Bruce safe. He expects a job. He doesn‚Äôt expect the gothic cold of Wayne Manor, the brooding silence of its only resident, or the unsettling depth of what Bruce refuses to say out loud.But as danger creeps closer, and the mystery surrounding the stalker sharpens, Bruce and Clark are forced into uncomfortable proximity. What begins as resistance slowly becomes something deeper‚Äîsomething fragile and real.

entry.title: What Remains When the Monument Falls
entry.summary:
Author: Hasunohana

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,054Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 10

Summary: The Batcave had always held secrets, but none as raw as Jason Todd‚Äôs memorial‚Äîa shrine of glass and grief, a monument to the son Bruce Wayne had failed.Now, with the Batfamily closer than ever, Bruce decides it‚Äôs time to let go of the past. When Jason is summoned to the manor, he braces for the same old cycle of guilt and discord. Instead, he finds his father standing before the memorial, tools in hand, ready to shatter that symbol of pain once and for all.As the glass fractures, Jason is forced to confront the question that‚Äôs haunted him since he clawed his way out of the grave:Who is he now‚Äî‚Äîwhen he‚Äôs no longer the dead Robin,‚Äîno longer the failed vigilante?

entry.summary:
Author: VHdeadinside

Summary: In a world where Batman never revealed his identity and everyone remains ignorant in the league, even though all the Robins are around and clearly the younger ones know who Batman is, Batman gets spotted leaving Wayne Manor and is apparently dating Bruce. Naturally this breaks poor Clark Kent's heart but all he can do is move on so long as Batman is happy. Except for the fact that Batman is never happy unless Superman is near him, so the idea of Clark suddenly dating men drive Batman insane, all the while Clark is nursing a poor broken heart with the support of the original league.
